metadata.synopsis: Dialog with harpers in Danthelon's Dancing Axe basement ambush. A number of doppelgangers have slaughered a Harper troop and stolen their faces, forcing the one surviving Harper to set Jaheira up for an ambush.We can see the trap coming, or pick up on Jaheira's hint that all is not right. Either way, it ends in combat.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Load BGO_Main.Teleport to larian://bookmark?name=BGO_DanthelonDancingAxe_Basement&mod=GustavDev&level=BGO_Main_A&camPos=-20.376675;45.939648;125.109711&camTarget=-19.833111;45.491306;125.819305Talk to any of npcs

8.speaker: Harper Geraldus
8.text: High Harper. May Selûne's Tears shine on this meeting.
8.context: InternalNodeContext: Jaheira in party, player knows harpers are doppelgangers (revelaed through True Sight or elsehow).

66.speaker: Jaheira
66.text: ...A very formal greeting, Geraldus. You are well?
66.context: CinematicNodeContext: Only the slightest hesitation - she's caught the use of the code, and is playing along.

99.speaker: Harper Geraldus
99.text: Y-yes, High Harper. Standing beneath Selûne's Tears.
99.context: CinematicNodeContext: Over-doing the code now, doesn't realize Jaheira gets it.

29.speaker: Hemm
29.text: The lad's a little nervous, Jaheira. We heard of your great victory against Ketheric.
29.context: CinematicNodeContext: Harper Chelvin steps up beside Geraldus, taking control of the conversation.

65.speaker: Narrator
65.text: *Geraldus' nerves are nothing to do with Jaheira, and everything to do with the doppelgangers beside him. He's using 'Selûne's Tears' as some kind of code.*

25.speaker: Narrator
25.text: *Geraldus isn't nervous, he's terrified - and he's using 'Selûne's Tears' as some kind of code.*
25.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of Geraldus darting terrified glances at Chelvin and the other Harpers

38.speaker: Jaheira
38.text: I understand, Geraldus. Take a moment.

93.speaker: Jaheira
93.text: And you, Harper - there is something familiar about you.

96.speaker: Jaheira
96.text: Something singular. Absolute, wouldn't you say?
96.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turning to player - heavy with meaning, signalling that this Harper is an imposter...

73.speaker: Narrator
73.text: *'Absolute'. Jaheira seems to believe that all is not right with these Harpers - that they're somehow connected to the cult.*

26.speaker: Jaheira
26.text: Doesn't she remind you of our old friend Marcus?
26.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turning to player - heavy with meaning, signalling that this Harper is an imposter.

19.speaker: Narrator
19.text: *Jaheira's meaning is clear: Marcus was a traitor, laying a trap. The same, it seems, is happening here.*

59.speaker: Player
59.text: You're a little lost. Probe Geraldus' thoughts.

22.speaker: Harper Geraldus
22.text: Jaheira will see through them. She must. She's fought doppelgangers before.

43.context: CinematicNodeContext: Doppelgangers jump forward at player.

55.speaker: Jaheira
55.text: Clever cub. This is an ambush - strike first, while they focus on me.

83.speaker: Jaheira
83.context: CinematicNodeContext: addressed to the player, who just distracted her by trying to read her mind

54.speaker: Player
54.text: Geraldus is the only Harper here. The others are doppelgangers.

74.speaker: Jaheira
74.text: ..The less subtle approach it is, then.

94.context: CinematicNodeContext: Jaheira draws her weapons (if Bronze anims ONLY)

61.speaker: Player
61.text: Marcus was a cultist - what are you implying?

0.speaker: Jaheira
0.context: NodeContext: Quiet, long-suffering grunt of exasperation. The player has just missed every single effort she made to single that we're about to be ambushed - so now we're forced to fight.

85.speaker: Hemm
85.text: Oh, Jaheira. Orin promised you'd make for challenging prey - but then you brought an idiot along.
85.context: NodeContext: Sarcastically disappointed, almost pitying - Jaheira just gave us a clear signal that we missed, and the Chelvin/ doppelganger finds it hilarious.

88.speaker: Player
88.text: Yes, Marcus. Shame such a dashing fellow turned out so evil, isn't it?

109.speaker: Player
109.text: What? Flirt with your Harpers another time. We're here on business.

71.speaker: Player
71.text: What is the meaning of 'Selûne's Tears', Jaheira?

111.speaker: Jaheira
111.text: To most people, a rather old-fashioned greeting.

11.speaker: Jaheira
11.text: To a Harper - a signal that there are shapechangers in our midst.

60.speaker: Jaheira
60.text: You should have studied Chelvin before you stole her face. She wasn't much of a smiler.

12.speaker: Hemm
12.text: Maybe not in your company, Harper. But after I gave her to Orin's blades, I promise you - she was smiling from ear to ear.

77.speaker: Player
77.text: Quite right - I wonder if the Weave will melt through this lot just as easily.

37.speaker: Jaheira
37.context: NodeContext: decisive, undercutting an ambush suddenly

92.speaker: Player
92.text: Remain silent and wait for Jaheira's signal.

84.speaker: Jaheira
84.text: The problem with Marcus, of course -
84.context: CinematicNodeContext: Jaheira takes a single step to the side, forcing the imposter Harper to turn with her - leaving the player an opening to strike.

1.speaker: Player
1.text: Remain silent and wait for Jaheira's signal.

58.speaker: Jaheira
58.text: My friend and I have experience with your kind, you see. The problem -
58.context: CinematicNodeContext: Jaheira takes a single step to the side, forcing the imposter Harper to turn with her - leaving the player an opening to strike.NodeContext: feeding next line 'we didn't end on the best of terms'. She's sussed that the person we're speaking to is a doppelganger and is about to strike first.

110.speaker: Jaheira
110.text: - we didn't end on the best of terms.

42.speaker: Player
42.text: Strike while Jaheira has them distracted.

36.speaker: Player
36.text: Strike while Jaheira has them distracted.

98.speaker: Player
98.text: Strike while Jaheira has them distracted.

50.speaker: Harper Geraldus
50.context: InternalNodeContext: Jaheira in not present, player doesn't know harpers are doppelgangers.

108.speaker: Harper Geraldus
108.text: I... I was hoping to greet the High Harper beneath Selûne's Tears.

20.speaker: Hemm
20.text: You have the lad a little nervous - you're the one toppled Ketheric out in the shadowlands, no?
20.context: CinematicNodeContext: Harper Chelvin steps up beside Geraldus, taking control of the conversation.

56.speaker: Narrator
56.text: *Geraldus isn't nervous, he's terrified - and he's using 'Selûne's Tears' as some kind of code.*
56.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of Geraldus darting terrified glances at Chelvin and the other Harpers

69.speaker: Player
69.text: You're a little lost. Probe Geraldus' thoughts.

7.speaker: Harper Geraldus
7.text: Strike, strike, strike - before the doppelgangers do!

115.context: CinematicNodeContext: Doppelgangers jump forward at player.

103.speaker: Hemm
103.text: Stare at me. Study me. This Harper's face bores me - perhaps I'll steal yours next.

17.speaker: Player
17.text: I'm sorry, Geraldus - you'll have to just say what you mean.

67.speaker: Hemm
67.text: Geraldus. You spoiled Orin's surprise. We'll deliver you alive for that.

117.speaker: Player
117.text: Why is he so afraid of you?

16.speaker: Player
16.text: Ketheric was only the beginning. You have information on the other Chosen?

113.speaker: Hemm
113.text: Can't say I know much of Gortash. But Orin is hunting you.

89.speaker: Hemm
89.text: And when I deliver your corpse, she'll let me keep your skin.

68.speaker: Hemm
68.text: ...Do you know? I took her face - but she died before I could get her name.

95.speaker: Hemm
95.text: I wonder what Orin plans to do with your face.

70.speaker: Player
70.text: I come in her stead. You can report to me.

78.speaker: Harper Geraldus
78.text: High Harper. May Selûne's Tears shine on this meeting.
78.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hesitant, nervous - stressing the words 'Selune'sTears' as a code and hoping we understand.InternalNodeContext: Jaheira in party, player doesn't know harpers are doppelgangers.
